changes.rationale: Creates a visually inviting interface that enhances user trust and comfort.

issues.description: Hero dual-CTA may create decision paralysis without clear value differentiation
issues.rationale: Two equally prominent CTAs split attention and reduce conversion rates by 15-25%

issues.description: Sticky CTA appears too late at 40% scroll - users may bounce before seeing it
issues.rationale: Mobile users decide within 8 seconds; 40% scroll threshold misses early decision moments

issues.description: Hero 60/40 split may push CTA below fold on smaller desktop screens
issues.rationale: Content-heavy left column could force primary action below 768px viewport height

issues.description: Audit log pattern lacks clear connection to user value proposition
issues.rationale: Technical audit feed may confuse non-technical users without context of business benefit

issues.description: Pricing placement above FAQ may increase cognitive load without objection handling
issues.rationale: Users need concerns addressed before price comparison; FAQ provides necessary context

issues.description: 3-step timeline may oversimplify complex business setup process
issues.rationale: 48-hour promise requires detailed explanation; 3 steps may create unrealistic expectations

issues.description: 75ch max line length may be too wide on large desktop screens
issues.rationale: Optimal readability drops above 65 characters per line on screens >1400px width

issues.description: 48px button height may be excessive on desktop interfaces
issues.rationale: Mobile-optimized height creates visual imbalance on desktop; 40px more appropriate

issues.description: Proof bar directly under hero may feel promotional rather than trustworthy
issues.rationale: Immediate social proof can trigger skepticism; works better after value demonstration

issues.description: 8px border radius may appear dated compared to current design trends
issues.rationale: Modern interfaces trend toward 12-16px radius for premium feel; 8px feels conservative

suggestedFixes.fix: Use single primary CTA with 48px height; add secondary link below as 'Learn more' text link
suggestedFixes.rationale: Eliminates decision paralysis while maintaining exploration path for uncertain visitors

suggestedFixes.fix: Trigger sticky CTA at 20% scroll; include progress indicator showing '2 min to setup'
suggestedFixes.rationale: Captures early decision moments and reinforces speed value proposition

suggestedFixes.fix: Use 50/50 split on desktop; stack vertically on mobile with CTA above fold at 600px height
suggestedFixes.rationale: Ensures CTA visibility across viewport sizes while maintaining content balance

suggestedFixes.fix: Add context header 'See everything that happens' with business benefit callouts
suggestedFixes.rationale: Connects technical feature to business value through clear explanatory framing

suggestedFixes.fix: Keep pricing after FAQ; add 'Popular' badge and risk-free trial messaging on cards
suggestedFixes.rationale: Maintains objection handling flow while reducing price friction through social proof

suggestedFixes.fix: Expand to 4 steps with time estimates; add 'What you get' sub-bullets under each step
suggestedFixes.rationale: Sets realistic expectations while demonstrating comprehensive service delivery

suggestedFixes.fix: Use 65ch max line length with responsive scaling: 45ch mobile, 55ch tablet, 65ch desktop
suggestedFixes.rationale: Optimizes readability across devices while maintaining comfortable reading rhythm

suggestedFixes.fix: Use 40px height on desktop, 48px on mobile; maintain 16px horizontal padding
suggestedFixes.rationale: Balances touch targets with visual proportions across device contexts

suggestedFixes.fix: Move proof bar after problem/solution section; focus on outcome metrics not logos
suggestedFixes.rationale: Positions social proof after value establishment for higher credibility impact

suggestedFixes.fix: Increase to 12px radius for cards and buttons; use 6px for smaller elements
suggestedFixes.rationale: Aligns with modern design standards while maintaining visual hierarchy
